meanings.def: two lenses in a frame that rests on the nose and ears. People wear spectacles in order to be able to see better or to protect their eyes from bright light.
examples: a spectacle case (= to put your spectacles in)

meanings.def: a performance or an event that is very impressive and exciting to look at
examples: The carnival parade was a magnificent spectacle.
I attended solely to witness the sheer spectacle of a political rally.
The Olympics are a wonderful visual spectacle.

meanings.def: a sight or view that is very impressive to look at
examples: The sunset was a stunning spectacle.
The wide plain, with thousands of wildebeest on the move, was an awesome spectacle.

meanings.def: an unusual or surprising sight or situation that attracts a lot of attention
examples: I remember the sad spectacle of her standing in her wedding dress, covered in mud.
the sad spectacle of him struggling to keep up with the younger players

meanings.def: to draw attention to yourself by behaving or dressing in a silly way in public

idioms.def: to draw attention to yourself by behaving or dressing in a silly way in public
